channel.title: BFG Power Supply
channel.description:
My computer spewed smoke and orange fluid, popped and fizzed then died lol. Has anyone else had this issue with bfg 550w power supplies? does anybody know if it took the rest of my hardware with it? Bfg is sending a new one in a month but if it's just going to happen again should I just buy an antec?
Edit: wrong board fail!!!!!!!!!

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

I have a bfg tech 650watt, been using it for a good two months+ since my new build.

No problems so far, and hopefully none in the future. gl pplsuqbawlz

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Wow sweet wasn’t actually expecting you to buy the big one but its great that you did, currently I have a ultra - ultra grid case with 550w power supply (not modular) and its been going for about 2 years no problems, and I built one with that 600 Watt one and it works great, cable managment is easy. I really hope your happy with it, if not I’ll feel really bad espeically if something goes wrong but I think you should not have any problems, I am going to buy another ultra one for my next build if that is any reassurance.

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

I ordered the 1000! I hope it works well ultra seems nice. I’m thinking of ordering a 16gig mem set while I’m at it hehe

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:2, topic:307548”]Guessing a capacitor asploaded? I’ve been using Ultra PSUs for over a year now (since the last one blew a cap :P) and haven’t had any problems.

As long as the orange fluid was confined to the PSU you should be ok…maybe check for burn marks on the mobo?[/quote]

Ultra is the best. I use there black modular power supplies and this design I have to say makes them the best psu maker. This is the one I have and it really makes the case’s cable management perfect.

TigerDirect

TigerDirect Business - Electronics, Tablets, Phones, Office Supplies & Video...

Shop TigerDirect Business for the best prices on computers, computer parts, electronics & more! With over 100,000 items online to choose from, we offer a wide selection of your favorite products. You shop fast, we ship fast at TigerDirect Business!

Even cheaper now Id say get it. I got it for 99.99 now its 79.99 here is all the modular powersupplies they offer.

http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/campaigns/campaigntemplate.asp?CampaignID=736&srkey=Ultra%20Modular

Looks great in any case it is glossy black.

Don’t get the 1600 Watt tho it has some problems with regulating power the 1000 is better than the 1600

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

There is a chance it taken all the rest of your stuff with it, or at least some of it. And yes, its all about corsair!

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

does sound like a cap blew tbh

while that sorta stuff can be due to design faults, i doubt that was the case, its just a fact of life that some capacitors with flaws get through QA, you were just unlucky imo

google the psu online to make sure there isnt like, some known design flaw, if not just accept the replacement imo

edit: that is assuming you weren’t overloading or overheating the psu

Read full topic

item.title: BFG Power Supply
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Guessing a capacitor asploaded? I’ve been using Ultra PSUs for over a year now (since the last one blew a cap :P) and haven’t had any problems.

As long as the orange fluid was confined to the PSU you should be ok…maybe check for burn marks on the mobo?

Read full topic
